page.title: 19HOLYWELL V.C. MIDDLE SCHOOL
page.content: Almost all of the village children pass through the local Middle school which is situated at the end of Red Lion Close. Built in stages but initially opened in 1973 the school now provides education for approximately 530 children from the age of 9 to 13. The vast majority of pupils come from the lower schools in the villages of Cranfield and Wootton. On leaving Holywell Middle V.C. School the children then continue their education at the Upper school in Wootton. There are 23 full-time staff and several ancillary staff working at Holywell. School meals are provided for those children who wish to have a cooked midday meal. The children who live in Wootton are transported to Cranfield by coach.
